title: Immigration: the waves that shaped Australia
creator_credit: Dept Immigration and Ethnic Affairs and Paul Woolston-Smith
brief_description: This video outlines the migrations which have made us what we are, starting with the arrival of the ancestors of the Aborigines, approximately 40,000 years ago. The landing on 26th January, 1788, of the officer, marines and convicts of the First Fleet, started successive waves of mostly European migration whose cultures enriched our nation.
